duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop, coordinate, and implement environmental health and safety programs in compliance with federal, state, and local laws, regulations, and guidelines.
Review and approve complex research projects, ensuring compliance with regulations such as NIH, CDC, and EH&S policies.
Integrate safety into Institute operations and promote safe work practices based on regulatory requirements and best management practices.
Assess risk of biological agent protocols, process applications for registration with the Institutional Biosafety Committee, and prepare policies and procedures for biological and chemical hazards.
Manage laboratory inspections and compliance reviews, providing recommendations to Principal Investigators (PIs)/labs based on regulatory compliance.
Conduct training on biological safety, bloodborne pathogens, chemical safety, and hazardous materials shipping, as well as assist in the response to laboratory-related accidents or exposures.
Develop written plans, training modules, fact sheets, and other communications, while collaborating with EH&S staff, PIs, and researchers to promote a culture of safety.

Provide 24-hour emergency response for Institute biological/blood spills, chemical/oil/waste releases, personal injuries, fire, etc., and contribute to the development of an inclusive working and learning environment.

Chair Institutional Biosafety Committee, be a member of the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee, lead the Emergency Response Team, and be involved in Radiation Safety and Occupational & Laboratory Safety Committees.

education_certification.credential: BS in Science and MS or MPH in OEHS with 5+ years related work experience, or BS in Science with 10+ years related work experience.
Ideal certifications such as CBSP, CIH, and CSP, or eligibility for professional certification.
Maintain medical clearance to work in biohazard high containment laboratories.
Working knowledge of CITI training and Cayuse platforms.
